service.tut.pori.contentanalysis

Class MediaObjectDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.tut.pori.dao.SolrDAO
      • service.tut.pori.contentanalysis.MediaObjectDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware

    public class MediaObjectDAO
extends SolrDAO
    The DAO for storing and retrieving media objects. This class can also be used to retrieve media object suggestions. Note that if you wish to associate media objects with photos you must use PhotoDAO, not this class.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MediaObject.MediaObjectType DEFAULT_MEDIA_OBJECT_TYPE
      Default media object type for search operations, when object type is not specified

      • resolveObjectIds

        public void resolveObjectIds(MediaObjectList mediaObjects)
        Sets all missing ids for the given media objects if ids are found. Objects without valid mediaObjectId or backendId+objectId pair are ignored.
        Parameters:
        mediaObjects -

      • search

        public MediaObjectList search(UserIdentity authenticatedUser,
                              DataGroups dataGroups,
                              Limits limits,
                              java.util.EnumSet<MediaUrlValidator.MediaType> mediaTypes,
                              java.util.EnumSet<CAContentCore.ServiceType> serviceTypes,
                              SortOptions sortOptions,
                              long[] userIdFilter,
                              MediaObjectList mediaObjectTerms)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Note that because of solr limitations, the media object count cannot exceed MAX_FILTER_COUNT.
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser -
        dataGroups -
        limits -
        mediaTypes - list of target media types for the search
        serviceTypes -
        sortOptions -
        userIdFilter -
        mediaObjectTerms - list of terms to use for search. Note: if the objects have mediaObjectIds set, these will be directly used as filter
        Returns:
        list of media objects or null if none was found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - on bad values
